fields.message: Each individual block is sorted into the layout based on its position - notated by the number to the left of the content - and the columns set within the Layout Settings. You can drag and drop items as needed to move them up or down in the order. If you have issues changing the order because of the size of each block, click on the collapse icon in the top left of the block. Blocks are, be default, laid out left to right, top to bottom in the order they are listed, however there are some edge cases where the blocks are re-ordered based on the content.

sub_fields.label: Tab Index
sub_fields.name: tab_index
sub_fields.instructions: Having an issue where pressing tab on your keyboard brings your user to another form on your page? That is because Gravity Forms assumes its tabindex values, and you can have overlap. You need to change the tabindex on your forms so that they work as expected.

sub_fields.label: Ajax
sub_fields.name: ajax
sub_fields.instructions: Specify whether or not to use AJAX to submit the form.

sub_fields.label: Links To
sub_fields.name: links_to
sub_fields.instructions: The title of the link is used as the accessibility title.

sub_fields.label: Line Separator
sub_fields.message: Click on the settings cog to start applying styles to this component.
Displays the title of the post.

sub_fields.label: Format
sub_fields.name: format
sub_fields.instructions: Note that in order to create a custom format, you'll need to reference the PHP DateTime::format Manual.

sub_fields.label: Note
sub_fields.message: Displays the author of the post.

sub_fields.label: Links to Archive
sub_fields.name: links_to_archive
sub_fields.instructions: Whether or not the author name links to their respective archive.

sub_fields.label: Note
sub_fields.message: Displays all tags from the page, post, or custom post type.

sub_fields.label: Links to Archive
sub_fields.name: tag_links_to_archive
sub_fields.instructions: Whether or not individual tags link to their respective archive page.

sub_fields.label: Note
sub_fields.message: Displays all categories from the page, post, or custom post type.

sub_fields.label: Links to Archive
sub_fields.name: category_links_to_archive
sub_fields.instructions: Whether or not individual categories link to their respective archive page.

sub_fields.label: Featured Image
sub_fields.message: Displays the featured image for the post.

sub_fields.label: Featured Image Size
sub_fields.name: featured_image_size
sub_fields.instructions: Image sizes here are based on what's available within WordPress. Sizes are set inside Settings > Media.

sub_fields.label: Image Links to Post
sub_fields.name: image_links
sub_fields.instructions: Whether or not the image acts as a link to view the post.

sub_fields.message: No content to manage here at the moment. It's just a search bar and submit button.

sub_fields.label: Select Content
sub_fields.name: story_content
sub_fields.instructions: By selecting items here, it defines how content is generated and in which order. To change the order of how things appear, simply drag them left and right of each other.
sub_fields.placeholder: Choose content that appears within the Success Story layout.

sub_fields.label: Video Attributes
sub_fields.name: video_attributes
sub_fields.instructions: I would recommend leaving the default attributes and only adding more as necessary. Possible attributes include but are not limited to: autoplay, muted, loop.

sub_fields.label: YouTube Video ID
sub_fields.name: youtube_video_id
sub_fields.instructions: Get the ID of a YouTube video by opening the video on YouTube and copying the characters after "?v=" inside the URL. Be sure not to copy any other attributes such as the starting point ("?t=").

sub_fields.message: Click the settings cog in the top right of this component to customize the wrapper options.
Closes the wrapper component. All options are configurable inside the starting component.
If you hover over the number to the left, an icon should appear that allows you to expand this block in order to edit content.
